content.introduction: In this blog post, we'll walk through the process of building an AI chatbot using Google's Gemini API and React. The chatbot will allow users to interact with AI models, generate images, and more.

sections.title: About the Project
content: The AI Chatbot project is a full-stack application that integrates Google's Gemini API for AI interactions and React for the frontend. The backend is built using Flask, and the frontend is a React application that communicates with the backend via API calls.

The chatbot supports multiple AI models, including Gemini 1.5 Flash, Gemini 1.0 Pro, and more. It also allows users to upload images, extract text from PDFs, and generate images using the Monster API.

sections.title: Setup and Installation
content: To get started with the AI Chatbot, you'll need to clone the repository and set up the environment. Below are the steps to clone the repository and install the necessary dependencies.
sections.code:
git clone https://github.com/jefino9488/chatbotserver.git
cd chatbotserver
pip install -r requirements.txt

sections.title: Conclusion
content: The AI Chatbot project is a powerful tool for interacting with AI models. It provides a user-friendly interface for generating text, images, and more. With the setup complete, you can now start building your own AI-powered applications!
